result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber L. Piwonski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amber L. Piwonski in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:17 AM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 would be dismissed and read in.
State recommends a $200 fine and costs, DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample, no restitution was requested and there is cash bond on deposit.

Atty McFarland concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST to Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein

Victim is not present.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Pay a fine of $200 plus costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Submit DNA Sample
60 days in which to pay the balance of the fine and costs or set up payment plan

Money posted shall be applied to fine/costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2016 at 09:30 am.
